item.title: Build Your Own Haskell Web Framework on WAI
item.description: This article shows how you can build on top of the basic request/response handling functionality provided by WAI and the Warp server, to support some of the requirements you might have in a typical web application. The content is mostly gleaned from my research into the code of several WAI-based web frameworks to try to understand how they work. Building a web application was one of the things I tackled when I didn’t really know Haskell well enough, so hopefully this will be useful if you’re at a similar stage and would like to understand what’s going on in a bit more depth.
